intro: Eleocharis balansana, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a species of grass-like plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions, including parts of Southeast Asia, Africa, and the Americas. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes, ponds, and along the edges of water bodies. It has slender, cylindrical stems with small, spike-like clusters of flowering heads. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic ecosystems, supporting various forms of wildlife.
